intro: Hydnophytum subsessile, commonly known as the sessile hydnophytum, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and possesses specialized roots that penetrate the roots of host plants to absorb nutrients. The plant has small, simple leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Hydnophytum subsessile is often found in shaded, humid environments within forest understories.
